@Cointelegraph It is extremely unlikely that CipherTrace can trace Monero to the remote extent that they can trace any other coin.  https://t.co/KEygBZoEUy

1/ There is no reason to think there is anything novel going on here until proven otherwise.  The most likely answer is they're using methods developed *by the Monero community to improve Monero* to de-anonymize some specific transactions with external data.

Don't rant about companies developing blockchain analysis software. Data is out there, blockchains are public. Curious people will hack away and make sense of it.  Mix your $BTC, mix your $DCR, heck even mix your $ETH, use $XMR, and support developers working on privacy tech.
